turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: He wants a lot of money.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'll give him money. Tell him to put the...

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: He wants the money from your bank.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'll fuckin' give it to him! We'll go down there.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: You don't understand. He wants all the money that is in your bank.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I've got eight hundred pounds. Oh Jesus.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oh Jesus.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: He is sure you can do this. Of course you can not.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oh Jesus. Of course I can't.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Just leave her alone.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: I'm so sorry.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Leave her alone.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Is that everything?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Right. Okay. Good.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: It's about forty miles from here. I don't know if you've looked at a map, it's close to London but it's a city in itself. A Roman city. It's a nice house. I'm having a problem with ants. I uh... It's the warmer weather. I can't seem to find the nest. Sorry, do you understand "ants"?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I just can't find a nest. The root of the problem. I've looked everywhere. What's the Russian for ant? Sorry that's a stupid... Sorry. This is strange isn't it.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm pretty nervous. Are you?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I mean... "Ants." "I've got a problem with ants."

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: So. Is it different to how you imagined it?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I bet.  What about me? Am I how you imagined?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: And how was the flight. Sorry, am I speaking too fast for you?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Do uh... Sorry. Can you follow me? Do you understand what I'm saying?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Good. Or should I speak slower?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Do you follow or should I speak slower?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Uh... Are you a giraffe?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Today is bath day.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Sorry?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Happy bath day.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Syevodnya?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Syevodnya

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Happy Birthday. Happy Birthday.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: "Frenzy".

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yes I know.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: They go. John. They go.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: They go.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Of course. They go. Yes. Yes.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: They go.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oh, I don't know. In my job as Deputy Assistant of New Business at the bank would have to listen to the problems of a great many individuals. This took a lot of understanding and sympathy, to try to work out solutions to their problems. But, you see, I'm not in that line of work anymore. Nowadays I'm a bank robber.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: You don't understand anything.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I think that about covers it. I think I have grasped the part about you being dumped though. That's got to hurt, I imagine. That's got to smart a bit. I mean strictly in my observer's capacity it seemed you two were getting on Pretty Fucking Famously.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Unless. Unless this is part of the routine. You get tied up, stick around, distract me, they both bust in and Steal My Cup Of Coffee.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: It's makes it easier. Okay.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't want to know.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: It makes it faster. If I don't speak to the men, they fall faster. It's pretty obvious why.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: That's a relief. It's nice to know I'm a regular guy.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: So what are you going to do?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm going to drink my coffee. Then, we're going to the police station. Where there will be lawyers, loss of job, house, humiliation, gutter press, and probably prison.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: They don't blame you. When a bank employee does this they understand. You get your life back. Anyway I bet you hated that bank.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Even so I always felt the decision to burst in and rob it very much remained with me.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Why else would you send off for me? If you just wanted sex just go to a prostitute.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Well as it turns out I did.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You must think... I'm the biggest pillock... In the world.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: No I don't.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: In the world.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: I know you just want to punish me --

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I do. I want to very badly.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: So you're just going to be vindictive

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: In every sense. If at all possible.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: You can't hurt me more than I'm hurt already.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Well, Nadia, It it's all the same to you, I'd like to give it a bash.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Where's the restroom?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: I'm going to be sick. Where's the...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What? No you're not..

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: I'm going... I am... I'm going to be sick.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No you're not. How... Nice one. How dumb do you think I am ?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: You don't have to do this. I can look after myself.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Have you got your passport?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Shut up. Have you got your passport?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Give me some money.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: I don't have any money.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: I said I don't have any.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: So, uh, Alexei, which I know isn't his name...

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: I don't want to talk about him.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: It's none of your business.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Fine. Absolutely. Must be disappointing though. Must come as a hell of a shock.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: So uh...

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Look, if you want to know is he better in bed than you then yes he is.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oh Jesus.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: If what you want to know is does he have a bigger cock than you, then yes he does.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Of course. Of course. Of course he does. Of course. Thank you. Thanks.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: But, you know, so what?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Not the kids type then is he? Not that broody. You must be pretty miffed.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: He will come back.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: He left me my passport and ticket. It's pretty clear he wants to see me again.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah. I tend to tie up and abandon women I really want to see again too.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: No. But you tend to tie them up.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't want to talk about it.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Shut up. I'm not listening.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: You don't want to talk about it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Okay we won't talk about it.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: We'll pretend it never happened.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: So. What's it like having to fuck men you hate?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: I don't hate you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Okay. Let's... Okay. Okay. You have had sex with people you don't like haven't you? For money. To make money.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: And? What are you saying?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: And. It's wrong.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: And who says what is wrong.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: And that would be Morals. That would be one's own moral sense of decency.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: What's a moral orgasm John? Tell me how it feels exactly.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: So. What then? You just detach sex from everything..

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Whereas "Wet 'n' Wild" is an emotional journey. "Tied and Tethered". It's pretty moving huh? Like Anna Karenina.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Listen. I didn't go rooting around in your private stuff.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: So what? Do you just switch off in your head or do you imagine you're with him, or what?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Sometimes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Sometimes which?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Sometimes neither.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Some... What does that mean?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: There's nothing wrong in liking sex, John.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't like sex. I don't think I'll be having sex ever again.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Well, it's just that the thought trying to charm up an erection in front of a woman, or alone for that matter, makes me want to die.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: So now you hate all women?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I think it's my safest bet, don't you?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Oh. I think you will recover okay. I think you got what you paid for.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: You...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I got what I paid for.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: You didn't mind too much.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: It wasn't what I wanted.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: So what did you want? I think we understand each other, no?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You don't understand me.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: You don't understand you either.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Get out

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: You are throwing me out.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Get out.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: You know, in Russia, there's no work for women. It's a different world.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You don't have to say anything

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: What? I... I wasn't saying...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Please, there's no... Oh.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: I wasn't saying anything.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Then okay.  So how old were you when you met him?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Fifteen. You don't know him. He was very kind and strong.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah. He's a smashing bloke.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: The rest of the world, John, it's not all like St. Albans.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Thank Christ for that.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: You are pretty naive if you think it is.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm pretty naive? Look at you. You have to do all this, and what have you got to show for it? Nothing.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: I don't have nothing.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Well what have you got?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Do you know if it's a boy or a girl?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Have you had any before?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Are you scared?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Not really. Maybe a little.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: What happened between you and the blonde?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: The thin... the girl with small eyes. The one in your cupboard.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: It's none of your business. She didn't have small eyes.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Did she leave you? Come on. It's nothing to be ashamed of. Who did she leave you for? Your best friend? Her boss? A woman? Did she leave you for a woman, John?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: She's dead.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't know why I said that. She's not dead at all.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't know why I said it. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: She's alive?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: She's alive!! She is not dead?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Laugh it up.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You should stop smoking. You're pregnant. You smoke like a fucking lab dog.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: I'm trying to quit.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I've got news for you. It's not working.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: I smoke more these days. I smoke more when I'm unhappy.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Nobody's that unhappy.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Maybe I want to die. Don't you want me to die?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't want anyone to die.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Except for Small Eyes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Except for Small Eyes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: What was her name?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: You know you can come under the blanket.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: It's alright.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: I've got an hour. Can I buy you a coffee?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No. I think I better just go.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Okay. Thank you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Whatever.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah. No thanks.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Please. Why not?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Because it was a lie.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Okay. Goodbye.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Goodbye.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Something else.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Okay. Promise?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You can probably buy them on the flight.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: I'm quitting. This will be my last one. So. Goodbye.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Goodbye.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: You didn't deserve me John Buckingham.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Whatever.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: It's not mine.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: It's not mine either.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: It's what you came back for.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: I'm not asking you to marry me.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No. What? No. I know.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: It's more like a date.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: It's a long way to go for a date.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Tell me about it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What does it mean?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Maybe you will find out.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Hurry. I'll wait for you here.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: My name's Sophia.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Sophia. Hello Sophia. Mine's still John.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Is the flight full?

turns.speaker: OFFICIAL
turns.text: I'm sorry Sir. I believe the flight is closed.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Please check. Is it full? Please could you check.

turns.speaker: OFFICIAL
turns.text: You have excellent English.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: OFFICIAL
turns.text: How do you want to pay?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Cash.

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Just wanted to see.

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: You know the rules.  You do know the rules, don't you?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Yeah, I know.

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: Then start taking them seriously.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Yes, ma'am.

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: Lazarus?

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Oh! Gave me a start.

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: I'm sorry. It's these soft shoes I wear for my back.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: You hurt it?

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: I'm standing most of my day. They're for support.  Didn't see you in church this mornin'.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Been on the crop. May need to get some extra hands if I don't want to work on Sundays.

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: Well. It's good to see you.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Angela?

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: I need to uh...

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: Go on, Laz. You can talk to me.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: My little niece... she got this deep cough.

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: You take her to a doctor?

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: No. No, she can't go. Mean to say... they's just no money fo'a doctor. Her daddy left for a job, and uh... give her to me to look on. I just...  I don't know what to do.

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: Is your niece older than 12?

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Oh, she older than that.

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: My sister got a bad cough with her pneumonia. I just copied her prescription. You don't need to pay anything... just take it. But if she gets worse, you give me a call. I wrote my number on the box.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: This gonna get you in trouble?

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: Not if no one finds out.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Thank you.  Oh. My wife. She had a card here for her migraine pills. She ain't gonna be around no more... So if you...

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: I already tossed that out.  Somethin' you should'a done to that woman long ago... how she treated you. Of course, that's none of my business.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Don't make it less true.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: I brung you a little basket of goodies. Fresh squash, tomatoes, some okra, butter beans.

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: You didn't have to do this.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Just wanted to say how much I appreciate you helping me the other day. My niece, she's cured up, and I got you to thank.

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: Well that's good. I'm happy to hear it.

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: This was very sweet of you.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Well. Hope you enjoy it.

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: I bet you have loyal customers.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: You liked what I brung ya?

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: Been eatin' like a princess all week. Even got enough for us to take a picnic under the gazebo.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: That'd be nice.

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: I put on the lotion you got me. Can you smell it?

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: I's thinkin' about singing in the choir.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: At church?

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: Mm-hm. I don't know if I got a good voice or not but... practice is only on Mondays and Wednesdays, so...

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: You gonna sing me somethin'?

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: When? Now? Oh. No.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Come on, just a little somethin'. Right here. Go'on now, don't be shy.

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Hey. You wasn't at'cha work but that nosey gal up at the counter give me your home address. Hope you don't mind me comin' over.

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: What do you need?

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: I need ya help again.

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: More cough syrup?

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Can I come in?

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: I lied to you. It was wrong. But at the time... I didn't know what to do. Imagine you got an earful from folks about that gal I's carryin'...

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: Laz... you don't need to explain yourself to me...

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Yes, I do. Cuz I feel for you. Mean to say...  I got feelings for you. And I didn't want you to think... I didn't...  I don't want you to go away. There's better ways to say what I'm trying to say, but... they it is. Don't go away.

turns.speaker: ANGELA
turns.text: Laz. I'm gonna put my trust in you. I'm gonna do it knowin' all too well I can get hurt like this. And I have been hurt. Just like you.  Woman like me, I got a lot of livin' to do. But my days are precious to me. They all I got left. Don't want no more fuss. I want love in my life. You understanding me, Laz?

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: I do. God's truth. I do.

turns.speaker: BOJO
turns.text: He black alright, he just ain't blue.

turns.speaker: MAYELLA
turns.text: Why you stop havin' dancin' on Saturday? Used to have bands... all kind's live shit. Like a wake up in here, now.

turns.speaker: BOJO
turns.text: Folks can dance when they want. Didn't buy that mirror ball for nothin'.

turns.speaker: MAYELLA
turns.text: You seen my snake-skin shoes?

turns.speaker: MAYELLA
turns.text: Naw. They got some blue dye, though. You think them boots you got on come from a black cow?

turns.speaker: BOJO
turns.text: Wanna get on somebody 'bout live music, get on ol' Laz, there. He the one got this place shakin' back in the day.

turns.speaker: MAYELLA
turns.text: Don't gotta tell me. Me and my girlfriends use-ta talk 'bout them hard fingertips he got pickin' that guitar.

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: You ain't the kicker, are you?

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: No, ma'am.

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: Cuz let me tell you, you boys gotta run the ball more. You get into a kicking game, ya'll gonna lose.

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: Can I put it in your mouth?

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: ELLA MAE
turns.text: And, sir... do you have a size in mind for what you're lookin' for?

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: That young lady's size, right'cher.

turns.speaker: ELLA MAE
turns.text: Well, that makes it easier.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Mind I ask, what's all this business here?

turns.speaker: ELLA MAE
turns.text: These are whipped body creams. It's like a lotion.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: For your hands?

turns.speaker: ELLA MAE
turns.text: Some women prefer not to scent their bodies with perfume. So now they have scented creams. They help moisturize a woman's skin.  This one's my favorite. It's called Ginger Souffle. I recommend... applying the cream while the skin is still damp. So... perhaps just after a shower.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: I'll take a jar of that, too.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: Still need a lift?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Yeah. Transmission's shot.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Look it. I got somethin' for us. This is gonna help, okay.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: You gonna miss your bus.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: Holy shit.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: Sit down, man. Need a beer?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: Marv, let's get Ronnie set up here.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: They been keepin' a folder on me cuz of my stomach. Like how it was just before we'd play ball back in school. Thought it was just some tic I got, or ulcers like my daddy had.  I can't... shoot. Target practice I'm a pro. I tag between the numbers each time but...  But when there's really loud noises around me... somethin' happens. I get shaky and... I lose my breath. They called it anxiety. Severe anxiety. It can be fixed and all... just not in time for....  It's a long process but... they sent me home.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: I guess it could be worse. You could be comin' back in a body bag.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: I can't get Rae on the phone. She's not at home... none of her friends seen her anywhere.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: She's around. Always is.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: I don't know. She's gettin' crazy, like she gets. Begged me not to go. Got real down. I just think somethin's happened. Like she run off with someone. You'd tell me if you knew somethin', right?

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: You been home yet?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Uh-uh. I's hitchin' up the interstate when I seen your truck outside.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: You need a ride?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: This don't feel right. Kitchen looks just like I left it. I know, cuz I cleaned it.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: She ever tell you she was thinkin' of taking off?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: I just been so mixed up lately, Gill. And, you know, with her history, I can see how she could get scared...  ...and run.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: Ronnie. You can't see cuz you're too close to it.  These nervous spells you get. You never had that shit back in school...

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: That's not right, really, cuz I...

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: You joined up in that monkey troop cuz you had a plan for yourself. Army'd pay for school. You were gonna get a degree, maybe somethin' in business or agriculture and you were gonna make somethin' of yourself.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: And then you had to fall in love with the school slut.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Now wait...

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: With all she was doin'. With all the shit she kept doing! You stayed stuck to that bitch's ass and you wouldn't let go.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: I know about how she was like. But we was different. I's the only person she talked to about it. How she's abused. Terrible things, Gill, just terrible...

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: YOU HAD A PLAN! YOU HAD A GODDAMN LIFE! AND SHE JUST FUCKED THE GUTS OUT OF YOU!

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: It's not her fault, Gill. She's had to take care of me all this time, cuz I'd just start throwin' up... choking. Just losin' my grip. And she listened. She listened to me.  And... I got better. I don't get nervous like I used to. And since we been together... she been faithful to me. Put all that junk behind her...

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: The only thing that cunt's had behind her is me and half the town fuckin' her.  Your first night away, I come over and drop off the spare keys like you wanted me to. You weren't gone two hours and she was aching to get me inside her. Like she was havin' some kind'a fit.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: You gonna steal my truck?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Make yourself at home. You done it already.

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: It's not like I can't go out and have fun with my friends.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: You think I'm Ronnie's spy or somethin'? Come tomorrow that dumb- ass gonna be halfway round the world tryin' to keep his head on his shoulders. You think he's gonna be thinkin' about you?

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: You go to hell.

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: Jes? Jesse?  Oh shit... Wait... Wait... STOP!

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: Stop what?

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: Thought you had a skirt earlier.

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: I got others.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: This thing you got... I've heard people say, you'd fuck a tree if it was handy. I can see that.  But that nigger Tehronne. Thinks he's some player cuz he hustles dope and stolen hubcaps. I mean, I can see a tree. But that piece of shit?

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: I begged him. Don't see why he had to go...

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: I bet you did. Just had to get that black cock up in you. I swear to God. What Ronnie sees... you disgust me.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: The fuck you laughin' at?

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: You don't got half what Tehronne got.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Ronnie ship out this mornin'?

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: It's so stupid. Says to me that he don't want nothin' to do with no military career. Says he wants to move. Open up an auto shop with his uncle up in Knoxville. I said, okay. How about now? Let's go.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Nothing's gonna happen. Not like everybody over there is in the line of fire with them Arabs blowin' themselves up.

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: Can't be thinkin' bout him every second of my day. I'll go outta my gourd.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Why should you waste your life waitin' and wonderin'. Not like you're married.

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: I begged him not to go. And he did.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: You wanna go home?

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: It gets worse there. Leavin' me to my own mind. That's just not good.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Here. Pound this and I'll join you.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Better?

turns.speaker: RAE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Can't remember the last time I saw you in that suit.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Your mother's funeral. I's a pallbearer, remember?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: We leavin' this weekend. Deke got a friend in Mobile gonna get him a job at the water company...

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: If you come to talk about that muthafucka, I'm gonna get up and leave you sittin' pretty in that new suit he bought'cha.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Think this about money still, ya old fool?

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Say what you gotta say, but I ain't gonna hear you speak his name to me. Not never. You hear?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: How many times we been over this, Laz? How many times?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Thought we was gonna be friendly about this.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Carryin' on behind my back. Make me out to look like a fool to all our people. Tell me, what's friendly about that?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I'm not ready to grow old, Laz. Livin' with you. I feel it. Like I'm one foot in the dirt. Saw it happen to my momma. And that's not gonna happen to me. I got living to do.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: And you gonna live it with him?

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Rose. Folks get sick. But you do what you can to get on the mend. Our marriage... it just got sick. That's all.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Talk to me about sick. Ain't been right since I moved into that drafty house.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: I keep the heat on.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: That damned, rusty, radiator, bout burned the skin off my legs each time I passed.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Kept us warm for twelve years.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I deserve better than this.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Better'n me?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Better than what you give.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Rose... please...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Laz... You can't say nothin'...

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: If we get with a counselor. At the church, maybe they's...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I don't love ya no more.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: God forgive you, for how you done me...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Let go...

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: My Daddy told me that a younger woman would bleed me dry. And that's what you did. Ya bled me.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Let go of my arm...

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Would'a chopped my arm off if you asked. And this how you do me!

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: LAZ, I said let...!

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: You better pray, gal. You better pray...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Don't you lay a CURSE ON ME!

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: YOU SHUT UP!

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Careful how you point that gun, boy.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Or what? OR WHAT?

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Boy? You here to make a point, or you here to kill somebody?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Ain't gonna be callin' me boy when I blow your face off.

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: You sayin' you'll do what?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: You heard me, mother-fucker. I'll fuckin' kill..

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: BOY! You so green you couldn't stomp a baby duck.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: You testing me? Huh? You testin' me, old man?

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Test. Shit. What kind'a test you thinkin'? You mean like, if you a man or not? If you a killer? Only one way to prove that. You just look me in the eye, boy, and you squeeze that trigger back.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: GODDAMMIT, RAE!

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: BOY! YOU KEEP THAT GUN POINTED AT ME!  You need to kill a man, all you gotta have is a good reason.  You know she been here with me, don't cha? Been all over town, givin' up that switch you thought was your own.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: SHUT UP! SHUT UP!

turns.speaker: LAZARUS
turns.text: Put all your love and dreams into one woman... she turn around and give it all to another man. That's a good reason to paint the wall with me, kid. She'd fear ya then. Cuz there won't be no more question in her mind. She with a real man now. A real KILLER!
